perturbation.changed_text:
“Affiliate(s)” shall mean with respect to any Party to this Agreement any entity which controls, is controlled by, or is under common
control with such Party. An entity controls another entity when it owns or controls, directly or indirectly, fifty-one percent (51%) or
more of the equity share capital issued and outstanding of the other entity. 

For the purposes of Article 6.4 only, an affiliate shall mean an entity when it owns or controls, directly or indirectly, twenty-five percent (25%) or more of the equity share capital issued and outstanding of the other entity or when it controls, on its own or jointly, the majority of the composition of the Board of Directors of such other entity.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces a conflicting definition of 'Affiliate.' In the general definition, control is defined as 51% ownership. However, for Article 6.4 (Transfer of Shares), the threshold is lowered to 25%. This creates uncertainty as to which definition of 'Affiliate' applies when considering share transfers, particularly if a party owns between 25% and 51% of another entity.

cannot be held for want of quorum, then either the three IMPCO or the two MIL/MINDA Directors shall constitute the requisite quorum.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.4   The quorum at and throughout meetings of the Board, including adjourned meetings, shall be one third of its total strength or two Directors,
whichever is higher, of which at least one will be a MIL/MINDA Director and one will be an IMPCO Director.

5.4A. Notwithstanding clause 5.4, for any board meetings concerning financial decisions, the quorum shall be one-half of its total strength, and must include at least two MIL/MINDA Directors and one IMPCO Director.
perturbation.explanation: This adds a new clause that contradicts the original quorum requirements specifically for financial decisions. The original clause (5.4) sets the quorum at one-third or two directors, with one from each party. The new clause (5.4A) changes the requirement to one-half, with a different minimum number of MIL/MINDA directors. This creates confusion about which quorum rule applies when financial matters are discussed.

16.4   If the JVC fails to sell [one million dollars (US$ 1,000,000.00)] worth of Products in the Territory within [eighteen (18)] months from the date of

16.4A. Notwithstanding section 16.4, if the JVC fails to achieve the sales target specified in section 16.4, IMPCO shall have the sole discretion to terminate the agreement without the need for mutual discussion.
perturbation.explanation: Here, the contradiction is about the process if a sales target is not met. Section 16.4 states the parties will discuss continuing or terminating, suggesting a mutual decision. Section 16.4A gives IMPCO sole discretion to terminate, removing the need for discussion and mutual agreement. This creates a conflict on how to proceed if the sales target isn't met.
